intro: Sphaerine distichophylla, commonly known as the two-ranked sphaerine, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, two-ranked leaves that are opposite in arrangement. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Sphaerine distichophylla is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in semi-arid environments.
